agency_name: PARKVIEW BEHAVIORAL HEALTH INSTITUTE - PARK CENTER
agency_desc: A designated community mental health center for Adams, Allen, and Wells County, offering a range of mental health and addiction treatment services.
site_name: PARKVIEW BEHAVIORAL HEALTH INSTITUTE - PARK CENTER - BLUFFTON
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call for initial screening.

site_schedule.name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders

site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: AGING AND IN-HOME SERVICES OF NORTHEAST INDIANA - MEAL SITES
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides nutrition services to older adults and disabled individuals.
service_name: CONGREGATE MEAL SITES - CAPRI II HOUSING
service_description: Offers a hot, nutritious lunch each weekday for area seniors.
site_details: Call at least 24 hours in advance to make a reservation.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older and their spouses -- Persons with physical disabilities

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit in Wells County that provides services to strengthen and support for families, youth, and their communities.
service_description: Provides a parent-lead group for parents to build friendships and support systems and increase parenting skills.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or email to register.
site_eligibility: Parents
Living in Wells County - Grades 6-12
Those struggling with substance abuse
Living in Wells County
Young moms

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Bluffton in Wells County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
site_details: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Bluffton in Wells County.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Office: 8am-5pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Bluffton in Wells County
Open; serves the city of Bluffton in Wells County -- New services: All bills must be paid up to current date to start a new service.
Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Bluffton in Wells County.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Bluffton in Wells County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city.
service_description: Serves as a city court for city ordinance and traffic violations in the city of Bluffton in Wells County.
site_details: Call for information or follow instructions on ticket or police paperwork.
site_eligibility: Persons ordered to appear in front of or pay a fine to this court

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the city of Bluffton in Wells County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Wells County

agency_name: WELLS COMMUNITY BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB
agency_desc: A nonprofit club for youth.
site_name: WELLS COMMUNITY BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB
service_description: Provides a positive, supervised environment for young people after school and over the summer. Programs emphasize character and leadership, education and career development, the arts, life skills, health and fitness, sports, and recreation.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

site_schedule.name: Boys/Girls Clubs
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 10am-5:30pm -- School Year Clubs: Mon-Fri 2:30pm-5:30pm -- Summer Clubs: 7am-5:30pm

site_schedule.name: Youth Enrichment Programs
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 10am-5:30pm -- School Year Clubs: Mon-Fri 2:30pm-5:30pm -- Summer Clubs: 7am-5:30pm

site_eligibility: Boys and girls age 5-18 years-old

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing services to promote independence, dignity, and advocacy for all older adults and persons with disabilities.
service_description: Provides assistance to seniors and people with disabilities with home economic needs like light housekeeping, reading mail, and running errands.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -OR- Persons with a physical disability -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance
Age 55 or older
Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Provides vouchers for low-cost spay and neuter services for dogs and cats to low-income individuals in Wells County. Eligible applicants must be able to demonstrate a financial need. Additional discounts may be available.
site_details: Walk in or call for information on receiving a voucher.
site_eligibility: Pet owners -- With low income or in financial need -OR- receiving public assistance or supplemental income
With a child receiving treatment at Riley Children's Hospital
Open to individuals and groups; specific volunteer options may have restrictions

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit agency that provides adoption support services.
service_description: Provides support and guidance for individuals and couples seeking international or domestic adoptions, by helping them navigate the pre-adoption process. Advocates provide information on adoption agencies, home study processes, and adoption-related laws or policies.
site_details: Visit the website www.loving-shepherd.org to fill out an assessment form. Call to request a form be mailed to you or for information
site_eligibility: Individuals or couples seeking domestic or international adoption -- In the beginning stages of the adoption process

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Wells County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Wells County, which is then used to assess taxes.  Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during business hours for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Wells County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Varies by service; call for details.
Varies by service; serves Wells County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Wells County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Petition Filing Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Wells County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Varies by service
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Wells County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Bluffton in Wells County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Bluffton in Wells County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the station.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.

service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.

site_schedule.name: Home Library Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri 9am-6pm; Sat 9am-2pm -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Mon, Wed, Thurs, and Fri 10am-6pm; Tues noon-8pm; Sat 9am-noon

site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or owning property in Wells County
Persons who are home bound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: WELLS COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - OSSIAN BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.

site_schedule.name: Home Library Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri 9am-5pm; Sat 9am-noon -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Mon noon-8pm; Tues-Thurs 10am-6pm; Fri 10am-5pm; Sat 9am-noon

site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or owning property in Wells County
Persons who are home bound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability

agency_desc: A government entity of Bluffton city that enforces animal ordinances, shelters animals, and operates animal services.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Wells County, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from county residents. Provides lost-and-found services and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Dead animal pick-up is inclusive to the city of Bluffton.
site_details: Call for information, to make a  report, or to schedule an appointment. -- On site services are by appointment only.
site_eligibility: Dead Animal Pick-up: City of Bluffton -- All Other Services: Living in Wells County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits. Additional benefits with the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), include: Filing disability claims, checking the claim for accuracy, filing the claim with the VA regional office, tracking the claim through processing, reviewing each VA action and decision for correctness, and assisting with appeals.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Honorably discharged veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran
Veterans living in Wells County -- With an appointment at the veterans' hospital or clinic in Fort Wayne, Marion, and Indianapolis, Indiana

agency_desc: A non-profit organization that offers mental health information, referrals, and educational resources.
service_description: Offers mental health information, referrals, and educational resources. Advocates on behalf of adults and children with mental and emotional disorders and their families. Promotes increased public awareness on mental health issues and lobbies for public and private policies that protect the rights and well-being of persons with mental illness.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: WELLS COUNTY FOOD AND CLOTHING BANK
agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food and clothing pantry serving Wells County.
site_name: WELLS COUNTY FOOD AND CLOTHING BANK
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and clothing to people in need. Limited service area.
site_eligibility: Written referral from Wells County Department of Family Resources -- Not received assistance from this pantry in the past month

agency_desc: A commercial hospital that offers emergency medical care.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Perishable food sometimes available depending on donations. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Well County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Wells County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Wells County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Wells County
To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization that provides financial assistance to those in need.
service_description: Provides emergency financial assistance up to two times per year for individuals and families in crisis. Depending on funds, assistance may be available for rent payment, gas, electric, and water utility bills, prescription assistance, transportation, or other emergency financial needs on a case-by-case basis. Funds are generally limited to $100; some exceptions may be considered.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail with contact information and reason for needing assistance. -- A volunteer will return calls to schedule an interview.
site_eligibility: Living in Wells County -- Not received this assistance more than twice in the past year

agency_name: COMMUNITY CARE OF NORTHEAST INDIANA, INC
agency_desc: Offers practical, emotional, and spiritual support to women, men, and children of Wells County who are seeking assistance with difficulties in their daily lives.
service_name: GRACE AND MERCY TRANSITIONAL HOUSING - WOMEN
service_description: Faith-based transitional housing program that provides safe and secure housing for women and women with children.  Grace & Mercy's 9-12 month life-skill recovery program serves women  looking for re-entry from incarceration, safe housing due to domestic situations, are currently homeless, recent release from rehab, substance abuse, or those wanting a fresh start.
site_details: Call or visit the website www.cc-wc.org to fill out an application.
site_eligibility: Women 18 years or older with or without children

agency_name: COMMUNITY CARE OF NORTHEAST INDIANA, INC
agency_desc: Offers practical, emotional, and spiritual support to women, men, and children of Wells County who are seeking assistance with difficulties in their daily lives.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for individuals and families in need. Assistance available for general needs such as clothing, rent, gas, electric, or water bills, car repairs, or bus passes. Assistance is given on a case-by-case basis and is dependent on funding. Offers referral and information for community resources.
site_details: Call to make an appointment; leave a voicemail with contact information.
site_eligibility: Financial hardship

agency_name: COMMUNITY CARE OF NORTHEAST INDIANA, INC
agency_desc: Offers practical, emotional, and spiritual support to women, men, and children of Wells County who are seeking assistance with difficulties in their daily lives.
service_description: Provides a thrift store selling clothing, household goods, small appliances, and furniture at discounted prices. Also accepts donations. Proceeds from the thrift store go to help families in need within the community.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Wells County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
Varies by service; serves Wells County
Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: WELLS COUNTY CIRCUIT AND SUPERIOR COURTS
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases and traffic violations, in Wells County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. Landlord/tenant disputes must be filed in the township where the property is located. All other cases may be filed in any township in Wells County.
site_details: Walk in for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Wells County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Wells County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Wells County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Wells County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Wells County Courts

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing community outreach services, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Written referral required. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility:
Living in boundaries: N-Interstate 469 and Yoder Road; S-Highway 224; E-Highway 27; W-West of town of Uniondale -- Limit two visits every 30 days -- With a referral from township trustee or a pastor from one of these participating churches: Living Faith, Ossian Baptist, Ossian Methodist, Ossian Nazarene, Ossian Presbyterian, or St. Mark's Lutheran

Boundary map: https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=1ZE6_v-ZTdu4C6xLrRVSmC_M9e3xdcWo&usp=sharing

agency_name: WELLS COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
agency_desc: Promotes integrated solid waste management through recycling, pollution prevention and reuse in Wells County.
site_name: WELLS COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
service_description: Maintains a drop-off site in Wells County for collecting recyclables including: glass, plastics (1-7), aluminum, tin, and steel beverage and food cans, newspapers, magazines,  plastic grocery bags (not trash bags). Does not accept Styrofoam.
site_details: Walk in to drop off approved recyclables; call or visit the website for more information -- During COVID-19 crisis remain in vechiles
site_eligibility: Open; serves Wells County

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization empowering women, men, and families by offering several supportive programs.
service_description: Loans donated maternity clothing to pregnant women in need. Items should be returned when no longer needed, so that others may borrow.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Parent Support Groups
site_schedule.schedule: Group: Thurs 7pm -- Office: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 9am-5pm

site_eligibility: Pregnant women
Open
Pregnant women -OR- Expectant men - OR- New parents

Pregnant women (less than 34 weeks), with or without a smoking support partner (living in same household) -- Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy -- Willing to quit smoking and submit a breath/saliva test

agency_desc: A community pantry supported by a coalition of churches to serve food to those in need.
service_description: Provides  nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Drive through.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
service_description: Offers affordable internal medicine care for uninsured and underinsured adults age 18 or older. Services include adult medicine, laboratory testing, diabetes treatment, and patient education.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older
